channel.title: Object-Pool on Greg Bair
channel.description: Recent content in Object-Pool on Greg Bair

item.title: Object Pool - Proxying calls
item.description:
Note: This is the second post in a series about an object pooling pattern. You can follow along with code in this repo on Github. The repo will be steps ahead of this series, so don’t worry if there’s things in there I haven’t explained.

  • Dynamic Proxy
  • Why a Dynamic Proxy
  • Proxy generator
  • Wrapper
  • Combining the wrapper and the interceptor
  • Summary

Dynamic Proxy

For our proxy object, we’re going to use Dynamic Proxy from the Castle Project. This package allows us to create a pass-through object for any type that implements the interface we’re going to be pooling.

item.title: Object Pool - An Introduction
item.description:
Note: This is the first post in a series about an object pooling pattern. You can follow along with code in this repo on Github. The repo will be steps ahead of this series, so don’t worry if there’s things in there I haven’t explained.

  • Overview
  • Real world examples
    • Microsoft SqlClient
    • Ldaptive
  • Components of a pool
    • Object Pool
    • Object
    • Proxy
    • Object Factory
  • Summary

Overview

An Object pool is a pattern used to maintain a pool of objects (natch) that is useful in situations where initialization of those objects is expensive, such as database connections or network connections in general.
